meanings.definition: Moving back or away from a previous position.
meanings.sent1: The tide was receding from the shore.
meanings.sent2: The receding figure in the distance was getting smaller.
meanings.sent3: As the magician waved his wand, the rabbit receded into the hat.
meanings.sent4: The receding sunlight painted the sky with hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The receding sound of the train whistle faded into the night.

meanings.definition: Becoming more distant or less intense.
meanings.sent1: The receding storm clouds revealed a clear blue sky.
meanings.sent2: His receding interest in the game was evident from his lack of enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The receding memory of the event left her feeling nostalgic.
meanings.sent4: The receding laughter of the children echoed in the empty playground.
meanings.sent5: The receding warmth of the fire made her shiver in the cold night.

meanings.sent1: The receding roof of the old barn gave it a unique charm.
meanings.sent2: The receding hills in the distance created a picturesque view.
meanings.sent3: The receding angle of the slope made it challenging to climb.
meanings.sent4: The receding shadows of the trees stretched across the lawn.
meanings.sent5: The receding path led them deeper into the forest.
